purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of default tolerances for the geometric dimensions of shape elements.

inscope.li: assignment of default tolerances for the geomentric dimensions of shape elements;
assignment of default tolerances based on value ranges;
assignment of default tolerances based on significant digits;
the association of default tolerances with a product shape;
default tolerances which are bilateral tolerances;
default tolerances which are plus or minus tolerances;
items within the scope of application module Default setting association, ISO/TS 10303-1809;
items within the scope of application module Document assignment, ISO/TS 10303-1122;
items within the scope of application module Foundation representation, ISO/TS 10303-1006;
items within the scope of application module Measure representation, ISO/TS 10303-1118.

outscope.li: presentation of default geometric dimensional tolerances;
association of geometric dimensional tolerances to individual shape elements;
assignment of default tolerances based on an external document.

uof.name: Default_Tolerance
uof.description: The Default_Tolerance UoF specifies the data structure needed to assign default tolerances to shape elements.It includes the capability of associating bilateral or plus minus tolerances to dimensional values which are associated to geometry, based on either a range of values or on the number of significant digits in a given value. These tolerances are applicable when the dimension is not otherwise toleranced, and multiple tolerance classes may be specified for a given association of geometrical dimension values to a tolerance.
